body_html: @ekelsen I read this statement also regarding other softmax functions such as tf.nn.sparse_softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits. However, I do have this issue. Using TFdebug I figured out that an nan value (inf) often results from the output of the softmax calculation done within sparse_softmax_... Shouldn't this be impossible using a max value subtraction?

body: @ekelsen I read this statement also regarding other softmax functions such as tf.nn.sparse_softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits. However, I do have this issue. Using TFdebug I figured out that an nan value (inf) often results from the output of the softmax calculation done within sparse_softmax_... Shouldn't this be impossible using a max value subtraction?
